author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in a lowercase letter. **Important note: It is okay to have a package name that ends in an uppercase letter. However, you will need to wait until a registry maintainer manually approves the name.**
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Version number is not 0.0.1, 0.1.0, 1.0.0, or X.0.0
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: DSP, julia. You may find [CompatHelper](https://github.com/bcbi/CompatHelper.jl) helpful for keeping your compat entries up-to-date.Note: If your package works for the current version `x.y.z` of a dependency `foo`, then a compat entry `foo = x.y.z` implies a compatibility upper bound for packages following semver. You can additionally include earlier versions your package is compatible with. See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/ for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I know RIM does not pass name guidelines... However the package has been around since julia 0.6 (that's also the reason for using v0.2.0). The gihub link already appeared in some papers, that why I'm a little bit reluctant of changing the name... apologies!
It is fine, but can you adjust the compat bounds?

While I think having been around since 0.6 does give it some precidence for keeping the name, maybe now is the time to seize the day and make it something easier to google for.

Googling for `RIM julia` gives me nothing of relevence (googling `RIM jl` does find the package).

We renamed FDM.jl to FiniteDifferences.jl a while back because the name was misleading (there is another thing called FDM in scientific commputing) and it isn't very findable.
And that was annoying becaues you can't actually rename things as that would break existing users, so have to register a new package, and FDM must remain in the registry forever.
Where as right now RIM.jl is not in the registry, so this is the best time to rename if if you ever were thinking to.

> googling `RIM jl` does find the package

Event his doesn't find the package for me. I need to search for `rim.jl julia` to find it.
Ok, I'll change the name then. Sorry for the trouble.
Apparently changing the name triggered a [new PR](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/15346). I suppose this can be closed.
